articles.title: Singaporean family arrested at Selangor bungalow for growing and selling cannabis - AsiaOne
articles.description: On June 25, a Singaporean family was arrested in Selangor, Malaysia for allegedly growing and selling cannabis. Kajang district police chief Mohd Zaid Hassan said on June 28 that the suspects consisted of a 58-year-old man and his two sons aged 25 and 31, who…
articles.content:

articles.title: As Delta variant keeps Asia on edge, could Israel and Britain offer lessons? - South China Morning Post
articles.description: The rapid spread of a more contagious virus variant is a stark reminder to zero-Covid places that border and movement restrictions can’t be a substitute for mass immunisation. Jabs have reduced death and severe disease in places seeing a renewed outbreak.

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Deadly Delta variant spells more losses for Asia assets - The Star Online
